00030 String format(const char *fmt, ...) {
00031   char buf[1024];       // should be enough for most cases
00032   int n, size = sizeof(buf);
00033   char *p = buf;
00034   va_list ap;
00035 
00036   do {
00037     va_start(ap, fmt);
00038     n = vsnprintf(p, size, fmt, ap);
00039     va_end(ap);
00040 
00041     if (n > -1 && n < size)
00042       break;    // worked!
00043 
00044     if (n > -1)         // glibc 2.1+/iso c99
00045       size = n + 1;     //   exactly what's needed
00046     else                // glibc 2.0
00047       size *= 2;        //   double the size and try again
00048 
00049     p = (char *)(p == buf ? malloc(size) : realloc(p, size));
00050 
00051     if (!p)
00052       throw bad_alloc();
00053   } while (true);
00054 
00055   if (buf == p)
00056     return string(p, n);
00057 
00058   string ret(p, n);
00059   free(p);
00060 
00061   return ret;
00062 }
00063 
00064 char const *const digits = "0123456789";
00065 
00066 String format_number(int64_t n, int sep) {
00067   char buf[30], *p = buf, *p0 = buf;
00068   int ndigits = 0;
00069   uint64_t num; // for edge cases when -n is still negative when n < 0
00070 
00071   if (n < 0) {
00072     *p++ = '-';
00073     p0 = p;
00074     num = -n;
00075   }
00076   else
00077     num = n;
00078 
00079   if (num == 0)
00080     *p++ = '0';
00081   else for (; num != 0; num /= 10) {
00082     *p++ = digits[num % 10];
00083     ++ndigits;
00084 
00085     if (num >= 10 && ndigits % 3 == 0)
00086       *p++ = sep;
00087   }
00088 
00089   int len = ndigits + (ndigits - 1) / 3;
00090   std::reverse(p0, p0 + len);
00091 
00092   return String(buf, len + p0 - buf);
00093 }
00094 
00095 String
00096 format_bytes(size_t n, const void *buf, size_t len, const char *trailer) {
00097   if (buf) {
00098     if (len <= n)
00099       return String((char *)buf, len);
00100 
00101     String out((char *)buf, n);
00102     out += trailer;
00103     return out;
00104   }
00105   return "<null>";
00106 }
